extendedIngredients.name: asiago cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups (8 ounces) grated Asiago cheese, plus more for the top

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) grated American cheddar, such as Goot Essa Mountain Valley, plus more for the top
metaInformation: such as goot essa mountain valley, plus more for the top

extendedIngredients.name: cheddar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups (6 ounces) grated Irish white cheddar, plus more for the top

extendedIngredients.name: cooked elbow macaroni
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound elbow macaroni, cooked just under al dente

extendedIngredients.name: flat leaf parsley leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup coarsely chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley leaves

extendedIngredients.name: fontina cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup (4 ounces) grated aged fontina cheese, plus more for the top

extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme leaves
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh thyme leaves

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: pancetta
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (1-inch-thick) slice pancetta, cut into small dice

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for the top

extendedIngredients.name: unsalted butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: Unsalted butter, for the baking dish

extendedIngredients.name: whole milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 cups whole milk, or more if needed, hot

recipes.title: Cook the Book: Macaroni and Cheese Carbonara

winePairing.pairingText: Lambrusco, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Macaroni and Cheese. With rich, cheesy mac & cheese you'll want to cleanse the palate with something crisp and acidic. We recommend Chenin Blanc, Riesling, or dry Lambrusco if you're in the mood for a red. The PRONTO Lambrusco Secco with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 20 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: PRONTO Lambrusco Secco
productMatches.description: Crimson purple color. Aromas are rich with purple iris, clove and licorice. Medium-bodied, dry (secco), excellent concentration, rich finish, abundant fruit, dry. This wine offers complexity and richness on the palate.

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Preheat the oven to 375ºF. Butter the bottom and sides of a 10 × 10 × 2-inch baking dish and set it aside.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Heat the oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add the pancetta and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 8 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Add the garlic to the fat in the pan and cook until light golden brown, 1 minute. Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Whisk in the hot milk, raise the heat to high, and cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes. Whisk in the eggs until incorporated and let cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and whisk in the thyme, cayenne, and all the different cheeses until completely melted. Season with salt and pepper. If the mixture appears too thick, add additional warm milk, 1/4 cup at a time.                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Put the cooked macaroni in a large bowl, add the cheese sauce, reserved pancetta, and the parsley, and stir until combined. Transfer to the prepared baking dish.                                                                                                                            5                                                                            Combine an additional 1/4 cup each of Asiago, cheddars, Fontina, and Parmesan in a bowl, and sprinkle evenly over the top. Bake until the dish is heated through and the top is a light golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 375ºF. Butter the bottom and sides of a 10 × 10 × 2-inch baking dish and set it aside.
Heat the oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat.
Add the pancetta and cook until golden brown on all sides, about 8 minutes.
Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towels.
Add the garlic to the fat in the pan and cook until light golden brown, 1 minute.
Whisk in the flour and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
Whisk in the hot milk, raise the heat to high, and cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Whisk in the eggs until incorporated and let cook for 1 to 2 minutes.

Remove from the heat and whisk in the thyme, cayenne, and all the different cheeses until completely melted. Season with salt and pepper. If the mixture appears too thick, add additional warm milk, 1/4 cup at a time.
Put the cooked macaroni in a large bowl, add the cheese sauce, reserved pancetta, and the parsley, and stir until combined.
Transfer to the prepared baking dish.
Combine an additional 1/4 cup each of Asiago, cheddars, Fontina, and Parmesan in a bowl, and sprinkle evenly over the top.
Bake until the dish is heated through and the top is a light golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let rest for 10 minutes before serving.
